there's a few problems with white

rather than sampling one pixel because

have still have quite high value so it's

um this kind of optical illusion can be
seen where and this is a good example of

situation where this orange Square here
and this brown Square here are actually
exactly the same intensity um and this
is happening because on the darker side

judge that it must be a fairly bright

dark compared to his neighbors and judge
that it must be um a dark color when in
fact they're the same color and we're
just it's how we perceive the
